instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..

threads.title: 2011 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> repeating hard Drive Failure
threads.message: I have a 2011 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that is back for the 3rd time due to hard drive failure. Partition is unrecoverable. I have tried EasUS and Disk Drill so far. My question is, is it possible for a board or cable to be causing this recurring problem? I have replaced the drive 3 times like i said. Thanks for any help in advance.

threads.title: 2011 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> repeating hard Drive Failure
threads.message: It could be a bad HDD cable...

threads.title: 2011 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> repeating hard Drive Failure
threads.message: There is a difference between a HDD failure and just a corrupt file system, which is it?

threads.title: 2011 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> repeating hard Drive Failure
threads.message:
cable failure could be easily diagnosed with SMART. check for CRC errors, this counter shows controller <--> HDD data line errors. if smart is ok, next step is to change it to SSD. it could be simply the customer's behavior - i hade one with a habit of tapping rhythms on the palmrest. :rolleyes:
also, for HFS+ repair I strictly recommend you Disk Warrior, this utility works literally like a charm when diskutil fails.

threads.title: 2011 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> repeating hard Drive Failure
threads.message:
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] [USER="1309"]Inwerp[/USER]   Sector errors when hooked via USB adapter to PC running HD Tune.  [url]https://photos.app.goo.gl/XXqigPwwqYZorZ773[/url]

Like I said this is the third hard drive I have changed for this customer in a years time and I am getting suspicious of what could be the cause. :confused: So I thought I would run it by you guys. It is possible that its something they are doing. I know that their kid uses it but they swear that it just sits on a desk and he is very careful.
Good idea on switching them to SSD, I may just do that. I have heard of Diskwarrior I just never bit the bullet on paying the 120 for it. If its that much better than all the free stuff then I may as well do that also. 

Thanks again for the replies and have a great day!

threads.title: 2011 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> repeating hard Drive Failure
threads.message: Bad sectors are not caused by the machine. You either have bad luck or you are getting crap drives from someone or this guy is knocking this thing around. Swap a SSD in there and then in 3 months he will be back with a dead GPU.
